name: Hilton Los Angeles North/Glendale & Executive Meeting Ctr

reviews.title: Beware over-booking here
reviews.text: So we thought we got a good deal on this place via priceline (bid at least half of what you think its worth).

That was until we got there and they told us they had oversold rooms. They only gave us one option: the Hampton Inn about 8 miles away. The good news is that they paid for the new place and promised to reimburse us for the Hilton cost, so the stay overall was free. But its horrible to arrive at 1:30 a.m. to be rerouted to a new place that's not as nice. A four-star hotel compared to a two-star one? Gross. I would have tried to find another place on my own had it not been so late (early?).
reviews.title: Excellent Deal from Piceline

likes.disliked: — Being nickled and dimed to death

reviews.text: I would have rather just paid for the Hilton and not have the run-around.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: Won't try to stay here again for that reason. I'm sure they would have rather had customers who paid the full amount, but they lost me for good.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Fantastic LA Location

likes.disliked: — 'Nickle/Dime' charges for parking, internet access, etc.

reviews.text: Have stayed at this place a few times for quick weekend trips to LA. I always book through Priceline and get unbelievable rates. (Bid LOW!) Anyhow, rooms are wonderful, views are always nice from city side or valley side. Service has always been fine, never more than a couple of minutes to check in or out. The gym is an above average facility for a hotel gym, pool is okay, lots of cement, not too much greenery, so it feels kind of apt house instead of resort.
reviews.title: need to remodel

reviews.text: Out of all of the hotels I have stayed in over the past year, the Hilton Glendale has been by FAR the most disappointing (and I travel for Business every week). This hotel does not come anywhere near the quality you would come to expect from Hilton, and they should really be ashamed of this hotel. I strongly urge those who are considering staying here to only do so if you have business meetings on Brand Blvd and would like to stay close to the office, OR if you have gotten some crazy rate on Priceline or Hotwire. Paying the full rack rate; or even a normal corporate rate for leisure travel to this hotel would be a bad mistake.
reviews.title: Might as well be a Holiday Inn

likes.liked: — Proximity to the offices on Brand Blvd
likes.disliked: — The rooms (Old, Ugly and Not Functional), Front desk staff, Uncomfortable Beds, TV / Channel Selection

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel on three separate occasions now, with each stay being more disappointing than the last. The inexperience of the front desk staff truly boggles my mind-- On one occasion the woman who was checking me in was unable to find my reservation for 10 minutes, and repeatedly asked me what company I was with (I was staying with over 30+ people from the same company on each stay), and she was unable to locate anyone under that company. When she finally realized what her mistake was, (entering in my first name as my last name!!!) they put me in one of their "Queen Size" rooms. Now, I'm not sure what unit of measurement this hotel uses; but there is no way that this is a queen size bed in these rooms. Full Size Maybe, Double Maybe, but it is NOT Queen size, and do not let anyone tell you differently at the hotel. If you are staying by yourself it is probably fine, but if you are traveling with a significant other this bed is simply too small. One other note; I find the linens to be extremely uncomfortable and stiff in this hotel-- I think they need to use a little fabric softener.
reviews.title: Nice, but thin walls!

reviews.text: Other than the bed size discrepancy, the rooms are small, poorly lit, and decorated like my grandmother's house. The TVs are at least 10 years old and the hotel has one of the worst channel selections I have seen from a domestic hotel. The desk is small and cluttered with the coffee maker, ice bucket, etc as there is no other counter space in the room. The desk to the chair does not adjust properly to the height of the desk, so unless you have an abnormally large abdomen, you will be uncomfortable sitting in the chair. Electric plugs are also an issue in the room; I found myself unplugging lamps behind the bed in order to find a plug in some of the rooms.
reviews.title: very nice hotel good restuarant

likes.disliked: — Parkinhg frr, having to pay to use the business center,Suspects stole a car and ran into the garage to hide so we could get back into the hotel for 5 hours

reviews.text: The bathrooms, are decently sized, but again poorly lit-- I found that they either have harsh fluorescent lighting or lighting so dim I felt as if the bulbs hadn't been changed since the hotel opened. One positive thing; in some of the bathrooms, the TV in the room faces the door so you can watch TV on the toilet.
reviews.title: good hotel

reviews.text: Other than the sorry state of the rooms, the hotel does have some decent faculties. The pool and fitness center look nice, although I have not personally used them. The steak house in the lobby is good, albeit very expensive. The room service has a very good selection, and most of the food I have tried has been good. The parking attendants in the garage are very friendly (maybe a little TOO friendly). The lounge on the 19th floor is situated in a very cool glass atrium. However, the bar in the lounge charges full price for all drinks, and they offer virtually no appetizers, so I do not understand what the benefit of having lounge access is; other than a cool place to sit and enjoy an unnecessarily expensive drink.
reviews.title: Such a Gem, would do it again!

likes.liked: — Almost Everything! Food, Pool, Service was excellent.
likes.disliked: — Parking fee and no cocoa in the rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From first site, the hotel seems deceivingly nice. It is a beautiful hotel, but that alone doesn't make for a great stay. 1) The parking was super duper tight. I had to park very close to the wall to ensure that my car doesn't get dinged. 2) The stay was last minute due to a blackout around my neighborhood. When I called the hotel, they gave me a AAA and a government employee quote. I even checked online to confirm the prices. However, when I arrived at the hotel, the front desk indicated that there are no AAA or government discounts for weekends. I regret not getting out of line and pulling out my laptop to book my stay online. Oh well. 3) The front desk didn't bother giving me the service bar key. When I remembered and called the front desk, he made up all these excuses. First, they ran out of service bar keys and would call one he found one. Then he claimed that someone stole all the keys. The next morning, I went to the front desk again, and the lady that was there had no trouble finding a key for me. 4) The room looked nice and clean, but the bathroom door would not close. 5) Walls are paper thin. I heard doors opening and slamming all night and all morning. You can hear your neighbors talking. In the morning, you can hear housingkeeping cleaning and banging around in the next room. We had to turn our tv down to volumn 6 at night to watch the pay per view movie. What a rip. 6) Noisy hotel. There are people everywhere.
reviews.title: Not Impressed
Deserves its #1 rating

reviews.title: Best Hotel in Glendale
reviews.text: Despite what the other reviews say, in my opinion this is one of the few true hotels (not motels) in Glendale. It's also the nicest. It's in a great location if you want to explore Glendale, or even Burbank/Pasadena and some of LA. It's about 7 or 8 minutes from Burbank, and a little further to Pasadena. It's even farther to LA (only parts of LA, as you must remember that LA county is a huge place). If you're looking for a hotel in Glendale and don't mind spending a few extra dollars, I think you should go with the Hilton. It's the "main" hotel in Glendale. (which, just a tidbit, used to be a Red Lion years ago.. you'll notice a couple lions around the hotel to this day).

Hotel is typical for a Hilton. Very pleasant, comfortable beds, large desk, nice bath products. The staff was quite efficient and friendly. For me, this was basically a place to sleep so it met my basic needs. Can't comment on any of the amenities such as restaurant, bar, pool, or parking. My only negative comment is to avoid a room by the ice maker. I had room 410 and all night long I heard periodic ice dropping.
reviews.title: Pleasant business stay

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Hilton for three nights over spring break and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Yes, there were some things that I felt were inadequate or overpriced but overrall we had a very enjoyable stay. I did feel that paying $15.00 a night for parking was somewhat excessive but this was minimalized by the $79.00 a night rate that I secured through Hotwire. The beds were comfortable but small, definitely not two queens, more like two doubles. The view from the fifteenth floor was amazing, we could see the downtown skyline every morning upon waking. The pool, saltwater, was heated and large. The jacuzzi was adequate but there were no controls to activate the bubblers. The bar was extremely small and ridiculously overpriced, my wife and I paid over $11.00 for two bottles of Budweiser!! We did not eat at the hotel restaurant but the menu looked very expensive. The t.v. was not huge but did offer plenty of channel options. The bathroom was a good size and had nice bath products for use. The mini bar was stocked but we did not utilize as we had our own drinks. The parking garage was adequate but you did have to catch a separate elevator to get to and from. Check in/out was a breeze and the clerks that we encountered did not possess any attitude, actually they were very nice and when I asked for directions to the beach she handed me a pre-printed mapquest page to Santa Monica. We had no problems with any noise from adjoining rooms, hallways, or elevators as is sometimes the case in hotels. We never even observed a maid but our room was done everyday upon our return. The hotel is in an excellent location only a block or two from the 134 highway. There are two good family restaurants, Conrad's and Shakers, within walking distance and both offer breakfast, lunch, and dinner. If given the opportunity, and at the discounted rate, we would definitely stay at this property again. I can understand those who paid full price being upset with some of the previously mentioned problems though. Definitely worthwhile if you can secure a discount though.
reviews.title: good hotel at the discount price

reviews.text: One of the worst hotels ever. Parking is 5 floors below and scary if you are a single female traveler, very dark and isolated corners. Check in was competent, but young untrained people at the desk with a cocky attitude. Given a room with very thin walls, heard my neighbor on his phone all night, and also musty, maybe a smoky smell to the room. Room service arrived 25 minutes late, and yes, they even know how to ruin oatmeal. I guess there is no where else to stay in Glendale, thats why they charge so much, this is really a place to avoid, not worth the money or the attitude they give you.
reviews.title: Not worth a penny.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for two nights on a hotwire booking - with a good rate. For a decent place to stay, the hotel is nice. We are generally looking for a nice clean room and comfortable bed with not a whole lot of extra amenities. Our room was very nice and cozy. No complaints. Hotel staff that we encountered were wonderful and helpful. We had one meal in the restaurant. It was very good, but a little pricey. Cocktails and wine are very pricey. The $15 daily self-parking fee grated me, but the garage was clean and easily accessible.
reviews.title: OK Stay - More than we needed

likes.disliked: — Ad on upcharges and pricey cocktails
